# Import Modules
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
source.3e12a98a:
# Load Data
csv = '../input/billionaires-index/BillionairesIndex.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(csv, index_col='Rank')
source.2a6d3c12:
# Pivot Table for Billionaires per Countries
tab_country = pd.pivot_table(df, index='Country', values='Name', aggfunc=np.size)
tab_country.rename(columns={'Name':'Count'}, inplace=True)
tab_country = tab_country.sort_values('Count', ascending=False)

colors = ['#4E5166','#7C90A0','#B5AA9D','#B9B7A7','#747274']
fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Bar(
    x=tab_country.index,
    y=tab_country['Count'],
    marker_color=colors # marker color can be a single color value or an iterable
)])
fig.update_layout(showlegend=False,
                      xaxis_title = 'Country',
                      yaxis_title = 'Total Billionaires',
                      title = 'Number Of Billionaires per Country',
                      title_x=0.5);
fig.add_annotation(x=3, y=130,
            text="Top 5 Countries",
            showarrow=True,
            arrowhead=3,
            ax=20, 
            ay=-30)
fig.show()
